metadata.Title: CVE-2019-14491 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in OpenCV before 3.4.7 and 4.x before 4.1.1. Thereis an out of bounds read in the functioncv::predictOrdered<cv::HaarEvaluator> inmodules/objdetect/src/cascadedetect.hpp, which leads to denial of service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-14491` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopencv-calib3d3.2 - 3.2.0+dfsg-4ubuntu0.1+esm2
libopencv-contrib3.2 - 3.2.0+dfsg-4ubuntu0.1+esm2
libopencv-core3.2 - 3.2.0+dfsg-4ubuntu0.1+esm2
libopencv-features2d3.2 - 3.2.0+dfsg-4ubuntu0.1+esm2
libopencv-flann3.2 - 3.2.0+dfsg-4ubuntu0.1+esm2
libopencv-highgui3.2 - 3.2.0+dfsg-4ubuntu0.1+esm2
libopencv-imgcodecs3.2 - 3.2.0+dfsg-4ubuntu0.1+esm2
libopencv-imgproc3.2 - 3.2.0+dfsg-4ubuntu0.1+esm2
libopencv-ml3.2 - 3.2.0+dfsg-4ubuntu0.1+esm2
libopencv-objdetect3.2 - 3.2.0+dfsg-4ubuntu0.1+esm2
libopencv-photo3.2 - 3.2.0+dfsg-4ubuntu0.1+esm2
libopencv-shape3.2 - 3.2.0+dfsg-4ubuntu0.1+esm2
libopencv-stitching3.2 - 3.2.0+dfsg-4ubuntu0.1+esm2
libopencv-superres3.2 - 3.2.0+dfsg-4ubuntu0.1+esm2
libopencv-video3.2 - 3.2.0+dfsg-4ubuntu0.1+esm2
libopencv-videoio3.2 - 3.2.0+dfsg-4ubuntu0.1+esm2
libopencv-videostab3.2 - 3.2.0+dfsg-4ubuntu0.1+esm2
libopencv-viz3.2 - 3.2.0+dfsg-4ubuntu0.1+esm2
libopencv3.2-java - 3.2.0+dfsg-4ubuntu0.1+esm2
libopencv3.2-jni - 3.2.0+dfsg-4ubuntu0.1+esm2
opencv-data - 3.2.0+dfsg-4ubuntu0.1+esm2
python-opencv - 3.2.0+dfsg-4ubuntu0.1+esm2
python3-opencv - 3.2.0+dfsg-4ubuntu0.1+esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: opencv package in esm-apps/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.2.0+dfsg-4ubuntu0.1+esm2').
